ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a piece of chamber music and listened/evaluated other group's playing.
Chamber music skills
I was able to dive deep into one piece of chamber work with my group, working with each other and our coaches to make it come alive in our own unique way.
I learned so much about music from teacher and peers.
How to study, rehearse, perform, and commentate on chamber music
I learned how to rehearse effectively with people, and my coaches made learning Beethoven very exciting!
Learned to improve playing skills, new repertoire, how to communicate better with members, and phrasing skills.
Learned to better rehearse and perform chamber music. Experience working through complicated issues in a group setting.

In depth knowledge of one major piece of the Western art music chamber music canon, performing skills, analysis skills, but most importantly, communication skills in terms of articulating your thoughts and opinions about the music to your other group members and class mates
Learn how to play in the context of a string quartet.
I gained skills in individual musicianship as well as ensemble ethic.
continuing on learning, refining chamber music

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was incredibly fun to learn an entire piece of music over the course of the semester. The only weakness of the class is that, other than performance classes and coachings, there aren't hardcore expectations set for the class which puts much of the responsibility on the group.

Strengths: studio classes, coaches, pieces, groups, fantastic course!

A workshop or class on chamber rehearsal techniques may be helpful at the beginning of the semester.

Wonderful class-- chamber music at Yale is the best, and I could have it no other way!  It's a beautiful journey, diving deep into one piece of chamber music with colleagues over the semester, and you grow close to your group because of this shared experience.  

I wish, though, during studio classes, we could hear more from other coaches.  Wendy is the main commentator on every group during class, and she does a great job of giving helpful feedback, but I would love to hear more from other coaches.   Sometimes, I feel like they don't get enough time to give any detailed comments.  Perhaps for each group, Wendy could switch between the coaches to be the main commentator (have a different coach make detailed comments, come up to the stage like Wendy would usually do). 

Additionally, I would love to play more repertoire from composers of color and/or modern composers.  I feel like there are so many pieces of chamber music that challenge us as much as any of the classic rep does.
No Weakness
I really loved both my coaches and appreciate the time they gave to us. I think it would be cool to have guest professors come in for masterclasses to hear other perspectives.
No weaknesses!
Outstanding opportunity for chamber music development and one of my favorite ways to play music at Yale.

Strengths: you get very close to a group of strong musicians, you get to perform a major work publicly and get to interact with many wonderful coaches and musicians from all around Yale 
Cons: Sometimes it can be hard to schedule rehearsals, especially if your group is big and busy, but this is inevitable
Perhaps an easier format on which to communicate with group members and coaches about practice schedule would help ease some anxiety regarding rehearsals and coaching.

only strengths - absolutely incredible way to play chamber music!
incredible coaches, peers, the final concert is truly inspiring

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you're interested in playing chamber music this is a great class!
Yes! Amazing class!
Yes!!! I love chamber music :)
Yes, I love rehearsing with my group and learning from our coaches.  It's one of the best things that I have experienced at Yale!
Great community and teachers.

Absolutely. In an environment as supportive and uplifting as this one, you really learn a lot and thrive as a musician. Everyone here loves listening to and performing music with each other, and this is a great way to learn some excellent pieces while doing so.
Yes, as long as you get placed in a group that will challenge you.
Yes! It is such a fun class. The level of playing is very high and students are fantastic.
Yes. Great opportunity to play music with people who really care about the process and the artistry.
yes
Absolutely - there are not many classes at Yale that provide a similar opportunity and it was a truly wonderful time learning and performing this music with the help of the course staff
Yes- very fun
Of course. Chamber music is the best.
Yes! If you love chamber music this is a great course for you.
Yes, if they are interested in chamber music
